item.title: Furniture waste and electrical, 2nd November
item.description:
This is located at the rear of 406-438 Rotherhithe street near public walkway. Items have been dumped and contain the address of the individual believed to have dumped items - no a resident of the block. Ongoing issue of continuous fly tipping in this location.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Salter Road, Rotherhithe, London

item.title: Deep Pothole, 2nd November
item.description:
Pothole has been here for months. Now is very deep 10cm plus. Filled with pebbles and water. Pebbles get shot out by cars driving past.

item.title: Two separate street lights not working, 2nd November
item.description:
Two separate street lights both wall mounted. Both in close proximity within Mercer Street. One fixed to the wall of the Maison Bab restaurant and the other to the wall of the Temper restaurant. Both out of action for some weeks now. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Mercer Walk, Bloomsbury, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 125A Salusbury Road, 2nd November
item.description:
The bin collection was missed, My recycling bin was emptied just fine. The normal waste bin which was right next to the recycling bin was not emptied. I reported this and I received an update from fix my street that they were unable to locate the bin. I have been living here five months and have not had a problem till now. I was told to not obstruct the pavement with the bins. I will leave the bin right by the pavement but I will not obstruct the pavement. The please could the bin be emptied
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken and disused utility box, 2nd November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Romilly Road, Finsbury Park, London

item.title: Unsafe Zebra Crossing, 2nd November
item.description:
The zebra crossing located on Bourneroad is not clearly visible to drivers. The paint markings on the road are faded. As a result, many cars do not stop when pedestrians attempt to cross, creating a serious safety hazard. Although the crossing is equipped with flashing warning lights and a speed bump, many drivers fail to stop for pedestrians. The current measures do not appear to be effective in ensuring pedestrian safety. Vehicles frequently continue through the crossing without yielding, even when pedestrians are waiting or already crossing

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet
